gil.io.example
Class ExampleESAdapter

java.lang.Object
  gil.io.example.ExampleESAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IControlCommandInvokeable, IExternalSystemAdapter
public class ExampleESAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IExternalSystemAdapter

This class exemplifies the implementation of the IExternalSystemAdapter interface. It works in pair with the ExamplePMAdapter. Please see IExternalSystemAdapter.java for implementation details.

Method Detail

setup

public void setup(SignalMetadata[] signalsToES,
                  SignalMetadata[] signalsToPM,
                  Parameters config)
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  InvalidParameterException
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Does the initial setup of the adapter.

Sets up a sequence of signals to be read and written using the readSignalData() and writeSignalData() respectively.

Specified by:
setup in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Parameters:
signalsToES - An array of signal metadata specifying the signal values to be transferred from the process model to the external system.
signalsToPM - An array of signal metadata specifying the signal values to be transferred from the external system to the process model.
config - A collection of key-, value pairs holding configuration parameters specific to each implementation of IExternalSystemAdapter. Key-, value pairs are wrapped in a Parameters class for convenience.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Is thrown to force the caller to an error state that must be handled by manual intervention.
InvalidParameterException - Thrown if any parameter is illegal.

connect

public boolean connect()
                throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Connects to the external system.

This operation may block for a longer period of time since several connect attempts may be done by the current implementation of the ES-adapter. An IOException is thrown if there is a serious problem preventing a connection to be established.

Specified by:
connect in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
Returns true if connected otherwise false. Please note that false is not indicating a failure. The caller will call this method repeatedly until true is returned or an exception thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Is thrown to force the caller to an error state that must be handled by manual intervention.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Disconnects from the external system.

The call is just ignored if already disconnected.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface IExternalSystemAdapter

writeSignalData

public Result writeSignalData(java.nio.ByteBuffer values)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Writes process data.

Writes values, of the previously setup sequence of signals, to the external system.

Specified by:
writeSignalData in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Parameters:
values - A buffer containing the sequence of signal values to be written to the external system. The number of signal values and their data type must correspond to the sequence of signal metadata given in a previous call to setup().
Returns:
A result object indicating success or failure. A failure will indicate to the caller that this write was unsuccessful but subsequent writes may succeed. The caller will not retry to rewrite the same signal values. However, the caller will continue to call this method for new data. An IOException is thrown for unrecoverable serious failures.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the external system and reconnect.

readSignalData

public Result readSignalData(java.nio.ByteBuffer destBuf)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Reads process data.

Reads values, of the previously setup sequence of signals, from the external system.

Specified by:
readSignalData in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Parameters:
destBuf - If data is available this buffer will be populated with signal values. The number of signal values and their data type must correspond to the sequence of signal metadata given in a previous call to setup(). The given ByteBuffer has memory allocated just enough to contain the expected signal values.

When this operation is called, the given ByteBuffer has a preset byte order (endianness). The caller expects data to be added in that byte order. This has to be taken into consideration only if the byte array that backs the ByteBuffer is accessed directly. Using put methods, i.e. putFloat, putInt, putShort etc. is safe.

Returns:
Null or a result object indicating success or failure. When there is no data available null is returned. A failure will indicate to the caller that this read was unsuccessful but subsequent reads may succeed. An IOException shall be thrown for unrecoverable serious failures.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the external system and reconnect.

getInfo

public SoftwareInfo[] getInfo()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns software info such as version info.

Returns information about this implementation of the IExternalSystemAdapter interface, the external system and possibly about connected subsystems.

Specified by:
getInfo in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
Returns the software info structure for the current implementation of this interface and connected subsystems. Index 0 contains the software info structure for the implementation of this interface. If available; subsequent indexes contains information about the external system and subsystems thereof.

getStatus

public SystemStatus getStatus()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns the system status of the external system.

This gives an indication if the external system is OK or not OK. It may not be possible to detect the current status of the external system and in that case SystemStatus.NOT_AVAILABLE shall be returned.

If this method will be called or not depends on the settings in the capabilities object returned by getCapabilities().

Specified by:
getStatus in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
The current status of the external system.

getOperatingFrequency

public int getOperatingFrequency()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns the external system operating frequency in Hertz.

Specified by:
getOperatingFrequency in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
the external system operating frequency in Hertz.

getState

public int getState()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns the current operating state. e.g. run, freeze.

States only has a meaning if the current status returned from getStatus() is OK. Common states are defined in SimState.

If this method will be called or not depends on the settings in the capabilities object returned by getCapabilities().

Specified by:
getState in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
The current state e.g. running, freeze.

executeSimCommand

public Result executeSimCommand(Command cmd)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Executes simulator commands.

The possible commands and their parameters are implementation specific and is a contract between the current implementation of the IExternalSystemAdapter and the IProcessModelAdapter.

Specified by:
executeSimCommand in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Parameters:
cmd - The command to execute.
Returns:
A result object indicating success or failure. A failure will indicate to the caller that the command failed but subsequent commands may succeed. The caller will not retry the actual command. However, the caller will continue to call this method for new commands. An IOException shall be thrown for unrecoverable serious failures.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the external system and reconnect.

addProgressChangeListener

public boolean addProgressChangeListener(IProgressEventListener listener)
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Adds a listener to receive progress change notifications.

If this method will be called or not depends on the settings in the capabilities object returned by getCapabilities().

Specified by:
addProgressChangeListener in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Parameters:
listener - The listener that subscibes for notifications when progress changes. The listeners must handle concurrency since they may be called from separate threads.
Returns:
true if the implemantation supports progress change notifications and the caller can expect to receive notifications. Returns false when progress change notifications are not supported.

availableControlCommands

public CommandDescriptor[] availableControlCommands()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns a list of control commands that can be invoked from client software.

The implementation of the IExternalSystemAdapter interface may support a set of control commands that can be invoked to control the behavior of the adapter. This method lists the available commands. Commands listed may be invoked by calling invokeControlCommand.

Specified by:
availableControlCommands in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
An array holding the specification for each available command. If no commands are available an array containing zero elements is returned.

invokeControlCommand

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> invokeControlCommand(Command command)
                                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Description copied from interface: IControlCommandInvokeable
Invokes a control command.

Used to invoke commands to control the behavior of the implementation. The commands are specific to each implementation of this interface.

Specified by:
invokeControlCommand in interface IControlCommandInvokeable
Parameters:
command - The command to invoke.
Returns:
A map of result parameters.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given command or any parameter is illegal.

timeStepControl

public Result timeStepControl()
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Advances the external system one frame.

This method will be called if the adapter is supposed to run synchronous to the process model. The calls will be done at the frequency returned by IExternalSystemAdapter.getOperatingFrequency().

If this method will be called or not depends on the settings in the capabilities object returned by getCapabilities().

Specified by:
timeStepControl in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
A result object indicating success or failure. A failure indicates to the caller that the time step call failed but subsequent time step calls may succeed.

Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns a capabilities object specifying the features supported by this ES-adapter

Specified by:
getCapabilities in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Returns:
Returns a capabilities object specifying the features supported by this ES-adapter.

powerUp

             throws java.io.IOException,
                    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
Description copied from interface: IExternalSystemAdapter
Starts the external system.

This method blocks until the external system has been started. If this method will be called or not depends on the settings in the capabilities object returned by getCapabilities().

Specified by:
powerUp in interface IExternalSystemAdapter
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If the power up fails.
